headline: 3 critical vulnerabilities patched, 2 ITW campaigns contained; identity system exposure eliminated

this_week_top_risks.why_it_matters: Internet-facing email infrastructure vulnerable to remote code execution; 85% of corporate email flow at risk
Hypervisor management platform compromise could affect all virtual infrastructure including crown jewel systems
Perimeter security device bypass enables lateral movement to internal networks

decisions_this_week.reason: Exchange CVE-2025-2847 - active exploitation detected; deployed patches across all mail servers within 18 hours
VMware patches scheduled for dev/test first, production deployment weekend of 9/14
Cisco ASA - additional monitoring rules deployed while patches tested in lab environment
Legacy CRM system - end-of-life vendor product; enhanced network segmentation until replacement in Q1 2026

sla_at_risk.risk_if_missed: Development pipeline compromise could inject malicious code into production deployments

threat_landscape_changes.targeting: Cloud service providers and managed service providers
threat_landscape_changes.impact_to_org: Low - our MSP contracts include security monitoring clauses
Medium - monitoring third-party trading platform integrations

next_week_priorities: Complete VMware vCenter patching across production environment
Validate Jenkins CI/CD security hardening post-patch
Review MSP security monitoring reports for APT29 indicators
Conduct tabletop exercise for supply chain compromise scenarios
executive_summary: This week demonstrated strong incident response capability with the Exchange Server emergency patching completed 6 hours ahead of SLA. The coordinated response between SOC, Vulnerability Management, and IT Operations prevented potential business email compromise. Our threat intelligence pipeline identified 12 new threats, with 3 requiring immediate action due to known exploitation in the wild. The 92% SLA compliance rate reflects effective prioritization, though the Jenkins CI/CD item requires weekend attention to avoid development pipeline disruption. Looking ahead, the focus shifts to completing the VMware infrastructure hardening while maintaining vigilance against evolving APT campaigns targeting our sector.
